messages.title: Conservatives pledge support to small businesses
messages.content: Your local Conservatives are concerned about the number of independent shops that are closing down in Camden Town and Kentish Town. Despite attempts by the Council to get people to shop locally, more and more traders are losing their businesses for good, with rising rents and the harsh economic climate.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Assistance and support for local small businesses to help them thrive despite economic challenges.
Protection of pensioners' benefits and allowances, including a voluntary opt-out of free bus passes.
Ensuring local residents' voices are heard regarding the development of the High-Speed Rail link.
Commitment to freeze Council Tax rates.
Protect NHS spending and reduce bureaucracy to give responsibility back to doctors and nurses.
Invest in state education and instill discipline in our classrooms.
Value our environment and make Britain greener, cleaner and more sustainable.
Put victims' interests above offenders and put more police officers back on the beat.
Real welfare reform to end the culture of long-term dependency and make poverty history.

issues.economy: Concern about the number of independent shops closing down in Camden Town and Kentish Town.
issues.education: Invest in state education and instill discipline in our classrooms.
issues.environment: Value our environment and make Britain greener, cleaner and more sustainable.
issues.health: Protect NHS spending and reduce bureaucracy by giving responsibility back to doctors and nurses to get better results.
issues.socialWelfare: Real welfare reform to end the culture of long-term dependency and make poverty history.

housing.content: Residents must be heard on high-speed rail link affecting local housing.
